content:
• Monday, April 15, 2013
  • CNW

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: CNW +6%. SPR +6%. SWC +5%. RES +4.5%. RBC +4.4%....

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: CNW +6%. SPR +6%. SWC +5%. RES +4.5%. RBC +4.4%.
    After-hours top losers: SRPT -12%. CLI -7%. HCA -5%. EGOV -4.0%. KDN -3.2%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:47 PM
  • CLI

    Mack-Cali Realty (NYSE:CLI) intends to reduce quarterly dividend to $0.30/share from prior...

    Mack-Cali Realty (NYSE:CLI) intends to reduce quarterly dividend to $0.30/share from prior $0.45/share, representing an annual yield of 4.26. The Company plans to declare dividend on May 15 board meeting. Shares -11.2% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:43 PM
  • NTGR

    Netgear (NASDAQ:NTGR) -3.8% AH after resuming trading in the wake of its Q1 warning; shares are...

    Netgear (NASDAQ:NTGR) -3.8% AH after resuming trading in the wake of its Q1 warning; shares are now about $1 above their 52-week low of $28.68. A couple of peers are down slightly in AH trading: FFIV -0.7%. ARUN -0.9%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:42 PM
  • PNFP

    Pinnacle Financial (NASDAQ:PNFP): Q1 EPS of $0.39 beats by $0.06. Shares +1.3% AH. (PR)

    Pinnacle Financial (NASDAQ:PNFP): Q1 EPS of $0.39 beats by $0.06. Shares +1.3% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:38 PM
  • CACH

    Cache (OTC:CACH) files a shelf registration with the SEC to sell up to 4,848,484 shares of stock...

    Cache (OTC:CACH) files a shelf registration with the SEC to sell up to 4,848,484 shares of stock on behalf of selling shareholders. The company will not receive proceeds from the secondary sale. Shares -7.1% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:26 PM
  • NTGR

    Netgear (NASDAQ:NTGR) warns it expects Q1 revenue of $290M-$295M and EPS of $0.45-$0.50, below a...

    Netgear (NASDAQ:NTGR) warns it expects Q1 revenue of $290M-$295M and EPS of $0.45-$0.50, below a consensus of $299.7M and $0.59. The company blames challenges in transitioning its ReadyNAS low-end storage line, which led to soft channel partner shipments and hurt product mix/gross margin. NetGear's announcement comes in the wake of warnings from F5 and Fortinet. Shares are halted. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 5:08 PM
  • HCA

    HCA Holdings (NYSE:HCA) issues preliminary results for the quarter, saying its Q1 will come in...

    HCA Holdings (NYSE:HCA) issues preliminary results for the quarter, saying its Q1 will come in at $0.02 on sales of $8.44B, below analysts estimates. The Street was looking for an EPS of $0.90 on revenue of $8.71B. The company attributes the wider loss to a slowdown in the rate of growth in admissions and a weakness in outpatient volumes. Shares -4.7% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:52 PM
  • JCTCF

    Jewett-Cameron Trading Company (NASDAQ:JCTCF): Q1 EPS of $0.50. Revenue of $14.2M. Shares +1.2%...

    Jewett-Cameron Trading Company (NASDAQ:JCTCF): Q1 EPS of $0.50. Revenue of $14.2M. Shares +1.2% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:22 PM
  • SRPT

    Sarepta Therapeutics (NASDAQ:SRPT) says the FDA is considering accelerated approval of...

    Sarepta Therapeutics (NASDAQ:SRPT) says the FDA is considering accelerated approval of eteplirsen for the treatment of Duchenne muscular dystrophy. The agency has requested SRPT provide additional information from its existing dataset to help facilitate a decision on its acceptability for a New Drug Application filing under the Subpart H Accelerated Approval regulatory pathway. Shares -0.4% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:22 PM | 1 Comment
  • ECTYQ

    Ecotality (ECTY): Q1 EPS of -$0.10 beats by $0.06. Revenue of $13.6M beats by $2.78M. Shares...

    Ecotality (ECTY): Q1 EPS of -$0.10 beats by $0.06. Revenue of $13.6M beats by $2.78M. Shares +4.2% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:06 PM
  • XOM

    Papua New Guinea is set to join the global LNG game in 2014 when an Exxon-led (XOM -2.9%)...

    Papua New Guinea is set to join the global LNG game in 2014 when an Exxon-led (XOM -2.9%) project is scheduled to ship its first deliveries, but news today that InterOil (IOC -2.1%) had received government approval for a JV operating agreement for the project suggests an additional LNG export project could come on stream in the Asian country not long after.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:59 PM
  • LAYN

    Layne Christensen (LAYN -11%) tanks today after its Q4 misses across the board on a 16% decline...

    Layne Christensen (LAYN -11%) tanks today after its Q4 misses across the board on a 16% decline in total sales. Despite the miss, net losses narrowed in comparison as the drilling-services provider benefited from a comparison with a year-earlier quarter that was hit by a large write-down. A slump in civil construction business has been putting pressure on it's water-infrastructure segment - its biggest top-line contributor - with revenue for the unit declining 11% to $184M. Revenue in it's mineral exploration unit also dropped 32% to $44.3M.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:49 PM
  • TTPH

    Another recent biotech IPO to come out of its quiet period today and buck the selling is...

    Another recent biotech IPO to come out of its quiet period today and buck the selling is TetraPhase Pharmaceutical (TTPH +0.5%). A number of firms initiate coverage; Needham and Stifel Nicolaus start it with a Buy, BMO and JMP Securities with an Outperform, and Barclays with an Overweight. The stock has gained 15% since its March 13 debut.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:21 PM
  • MTDR

    Matador Resources (MTDR -3.8%) says Q1 oil and natural gas production totaled ~460K barrels and...

    Matador Resources (MTDR -3.8%) says Q1 oil and natural gas production totaled ~460K barrels and 3.1 Bcf, respectively, vs. ~200K bbl of oil and 3.2 Bcf of natural gas produced in the year-ago quarter and ahead of guidance. MTDR cites primarily improved performance and productivity of its recent Eagle Ford wells.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:59 PM
  • HK

    Halcon Resources (HK -11.6%) unveils a new Eagle Ford shale play as its fourth core area, where...

    Halcon Resources (HK -11.6%) unveils a new Eagle Ford shale play as its fourth core area, where seven wells producing, one well is being completed and three wells are being drilled. HK expects to spud 15-20 wells in the play in 2013 by operating one to threee rigs while spending ~$100M. Early stage estimates for reserves per well are 350K-400K boe.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:43 PM
  • ENTA

    With the quiet period out of the way, a number of firms initiate coverage on recent IPO Enanta...

    With the quiet period out of the way, a number of firms initiate coverage on recent IPO Enanta Pharmaceuticals (ENTA +2.6%) today; JPMorgan with an Overweight, and Lerrink Swann and Credit Suisse both with an Outperform (I, II). CSFB says that using conservative assumptions, the HCV market could reach $13B by 2020, which translates to a doubling of patients treated. Enanta develops drugs for the treatment of a number of various infectious diseases, with HCV being one of its key areas.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:29 PM
  • POWR

    PowerSecure International (POWR -2%) says it's acquired Solais Lighting, a private company based...

    PowerSecure International (POWR -2%) says it's acquired Solais Lighting, a private company based in Stamford, Connecticuit that makes LED lamps and fixtures for both commercial and industrial markets, for $15M in cash and common stock. The company exppects the transaction to be slightly accretive to revenues and earnings in 2013.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:01 PM
  • WINT

    Discovery Labs (DSCO -17%) gets slammed today after coming off an early morning halt on news the...

    Discovery Labs (DSCO -17%) gets slammed today after coming off an early morning halt on news the FDA had requested clarification and provided recommendations regarding the recently updated product specifications for Surfaxin, which is used to treat respiratory distress syndrome. The company says it plans to provide a response within two months, and if the FDA gives the green light, it expects to proceed with commercialization in Q413.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:35 PM | 1 Comment
  • URI

    United Rentals (URI -8.8%) fall off sharply and appears to be another casualty of a soft reading...

    United Rentals (URI -8.8%) fall off sharply and appears to be another casualty of a soft reading of the Internet Truckstop's Market Demand Index. Shares are at their lowest levels since late January.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:06 PM
  • VMW

    VMware (VMW +0.3%) trades slightly higher on a down day, and manages to lift parent EMC (EMC...

    VMware (VMW +0.3%) trades slightly higher on a down day, and manages to lift parent EMC (EMC +0.3%) in the process, after UBS says its Q1 checks indicate license revenue (a major concern following the company's light Q1/2013 guidance) will beat expectations. The firm maintains a Buy and $115 PT. VMware reports after the close on April 23, and EMC the following morning.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:03 PM
  • PAAS

    Pan American Silver (PAAS -7%) is downgraded to Market Perform with a $19.50 target price (from...

    Pan American Silver (PAAS -7%) is downgraded to Market Perform with a $19.50 target price (from $30) at BMO Capital, as a lack of growth and high cost structure expose shareholders to downside risk in a declining metal price environment. The firm cuts its EPS and cash flow/share outlook 58% and 34%, respectively, to $0.74 and $1.55, well below consensus. Also, SLW -7.5%, HL -8.5%.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:59 PM | 3 Comments
  • KNX

    A tough day for the trucking sector with Swift Transportation (SWFT -8.1%) leading the downward...

    A tough day for the trucking sector with Swift Transportation (SWFT -8.1%) leading the downward fall. The gloom is tied to a reading of the Internet Truckstop's Market Demand Index which showed a 21% sequential fall in demand for trucks. Decliners: J.B Hunt Transportation (NASDAQ:JBHT) -1.8%, Celadon Group(NYSE:CGI) -4.2%, Marten Transport (NASDAQ:MRTN) -3.8%, Heartland Express (NASDAQ:HTLD) -1.1%, Knight Transportation (NYSE:KNX) -1.4%.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:53 PM | 1 Comment
  • CNIT-OLD

    Midday top 10 gainers: OTC:MKTAY +143%. CNIT-OLD +21%. GENE +21%. THRX +18%. MCOX +17%. SGRP...

    Midday top 10 gainers: OTC:MKTAY +143%. CNIT-OLD +21%. GENE +21%. THRX +18%. MCOX +17%. SGRP +14%. S +13%. STXS +10%. ACOR +9%. LIFE +8%.
    Midday top 10 losers: UNTK -48%. GSS -19%. ASM -18%. DSCO -17%. HXM -16%. XPL -16%. NGD -16%. TGD -15%. BAA -14%. PZG -14%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:50 PM
  • ATOS

    Atossa Genetics (ATOS +2.4%) bucks a weak, sloppy market today, moving higher after Sidoti...

    Atossa Genetics (ATOS +2.4%) bucks a weak, sloppy market today, moving higher after Sidoti initiates the shares with a Buy. The stock has seen some considerable volatility this month, nearly after nearly doubling on the back of its announcement of a diagnostic lab testing deal and some bullish press in a Seeking Alpha article a few days later.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:50 PM
  • STP

    Disappointing Chinese GDP data helps fuel a rout in solar stocks (TAN -3.8%). A broader selloff...

    Disappointing Chinese GDP data helps fuel a rout in solar stocks (TAN -3.8%). A broader selloff in risk assets isn't helping either. Suntech (STP -21.1%) is the biggest loser, as the Buffett rumor rally officially comes to an end. JASO -11.8%. LDK -10.7%. YGE -8%. WFR -7.9%. GTAT -5.9%. SOL -8.2%. TSL -6.9%. SPWR -5.1%. JKS -8.5%. DQ -5.2%. YGE -8%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:49 PM
  • MYGN

    Heard in the Myriad Genetics (MYGN +5.5%) Supreme Court case: Justice Scalia asks why a company...

    Heard in the Myriad Genetics (MYGN +5.5%) Supreme Court case: Justice Scalia asks why a company would incur huge development costs if it is prohibited from patenting discoveries; Sotomayor, Breyer, and Kennedy ask if middle ground is possible wherein patents are allowed on cDNA but not an "isolated DNA"; Myriad's lawyers asked to consider if middle ground would grant "sufficient protection for innovation and research." (Bloomberg)

     
     
     
     
    | 12:38 PM
  • BAS

    Basic Energy (BAS -5.7%) expects Q1 revenue growth of ~1% Q/Q, less than its previous guidance...

    Basic Energy (BAS -5.7%) expects Q1 revenue growth of ~1% Q/Q, less than its previous guidance of 2%-3%, after reporting its well servicing rig count remained unchanged in March. But BAS sees Q2 revenue ~10% higher Q/Q, implying a result of ~$335M, pointing to recent improvements in the rig count, particularly in the Permian Basin market.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:34 PM
  • VAR

    Varian Medical (VAR -5%) slides on a downgrade earlier today from Morgan Stanley to Underweight....

    Varian Medical (VAR -5%) slides on a downgrade earlier today from Morgan Stanley to Underweight. The firm cites number of catalysts, including; accelerated purchases from customer for its oncology software products in FY12 making comps tough for FY13, heavy competition in the space from Elekta's Versa and Accuray's Tomo, a second round of U.S. reimbursement cuts impacting payments to freestanding clinics and fading large equipment trends in the U.S. and Europe.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:33 PM | 2 Comments
  • OCZ

    OCZ Technology (OCZ -8.6%) tumbles to $1.22 after receiving a NASDAQ delisting notice on account...

    OCZ Technology (OCZ -8.6%) tumbles to $1.22 after receiving a NASDAQ delisting notice on account of its failure to file 10-Qs for the August and November '12 quarters by the NASDAQ's April 8 deadline (originally disclosed a week ago). Shares have fallen 44% from a March 18 high of $2.17, and 56% from a Jan. 28 high of $2.77.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:32 PM
  • MTL

    Heavily indebted Mechel (MTL -5.8%) is in talks with several major mining companies in Asia,...

    Heavily indebted Mechel (MTL -5.8%) is in talks with several major mining companies in Asia, including China's Baosteel, for the sale of a minority stake in its mining unit, its CFO says. MTL has said it wants to refocus on its mining business and sell many of its other non-core assets in an effort to raise ~$4B. (also)
     
     
     
     
    | 12:26 PM
  • SKS

    Count Saks (SKS -4.6%) among the day's laggards as JPMorgan downgrades the shares to Neutral...

    Count Saks (SKS -4.6%) among the day's laggards as JPMorgan downgrades the shares to Neutral from Overweight. Analyst Matthew Boss says a rising tax burden on the company's key demographic could "potentially delay" H2 wealth effect driven spending. Additionally, the retailer "faces its toughest 2-year compare in 5+ years in Q2" and will be forced to cope with "rising gross margin headwinds." Price target reiterated at $12. 

     
     
     
     
    | 12:13 PM
  • ALSN

    In additon to Carlyle selling shares, Allison Transmission (ALSN -6.7%) adds to its own woes...

    In additon to Carlyle selling shares, Allison Transmission (ALSN -6.7%) adds to its own woes this morning by cutting Q1 guidance below Street estimates. It now expects Q1 net sales to fall between $455M - $460M , well below the consensus estimates of $471.56M. The company cites lower demand in its North American hydraulic fracturing market, as well as a reduction in defense net sales. It also reaffirms it's outlook for FY13, saying that net sales are projected to decline 6% - 8% Y/Y.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:08 PM
  • KBH

    Homebuilders are taking a hit today on the back of weaker-than-expected housing data: XHB -2.7%,...

    Homebuilders are taking a hit today on the back of weaker-than-expected housing data: XHB -2.7%, KBH -4.7%, TOL -4.5%, DHI -4.3%, PHM -4.1%, HOV -3.7%, LEN -3.2%, BZH -3.3%.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:44 AM
  • MYGN

    Myriad Genetics (MYGN +2.7%) spikes into positive territory after Reuters says U.S. Supreme...

    Myriad Genetics (MYGN +2.7%) spikes into positive territory after Reuters says U.S. Supreme Court Justices "indicate a reluctance to issue [a] broad ruling" regarding contentious gene patenting. (Earlier: Court to hear arguments in gene patent case)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:37 AM
  • CAT

    Shares of Caterpillar (CAT -2.7%) and Joy Global (JOY -2.7%) take a hit from weak China GDP...

    Shares of Caterpillar (CAT -2.7%) and Joy Global (JOY -2.7%) take a hit from weak China GDP numbers for the January-March quarter. The economiy grew "just" 7.7% from a year earlier, less than forecasts calling for growth of 8%, while industrial production in April slowed to 8.9%, the weakest in more than a year.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:34 AM
  • AMX

    America Movil (AMX -2.7%) slides after Bernstein launches coverage with an Underperform and...

    America Movil (AMX -2.7%) slides after Bernstein launches coverage with an Underperform and $16.50 PT. Over the weekend, Bloomberg observed Carlos Slim might try to make lemonade out of lemons by using Mexico's proposed telecom reform legislation (a negative for AMX's mobile ops) to expand into pay-TV services, and thereby take on local giant Grupo Televisa (NYSE:TV).

     
     
     
     
    | 11:32 AM
  • LULU

    Shares of Lululemon (LULU +2.4%) buck a weak tape to trade higher as reports come in that the...

    Shares of Lululemon (LULU +2.4%) buck a weak tape to trade higher as reports come in that the retailer is getting its production issues solved. Though the mishap with yoga pants that were deemed too sheer was costly, the general consensus from analysts is that the brand will keep its loyal base of adherents.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:26 AM | 3 Comments
  • GOLD

    Barrick Gold (ABX -11.2%) is downgraded to Neutral at J.P. Morgan, which says ABX "has been most...

    Barrick Gold (ABX -11.2%) is downgraded to Neutral at J.P. Morgan, which says ABX "has been most exposed to capital spending overruns and is still in growth mode while investors have changed." Gold's pullback adds to uncertainties from the shutdown of the Chilean side of its Pascua-Lama project and demands from the Dominican Republic for a bigger share of early cash flow from its PV project.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:22 AM | 1 Comment
  • C

    Reducing the drag on earnings from Citi Holdings remains a key focus, says Citigroup (C +2.5%)...

    Reducing the drag on earnings from Citi Holdings remains a key focus, says Citigroup (C +2.5%) CEO Mike Corbat on the earnings call, noting the unit's toxic assets were cut 29% Y/Y to $149B (presentation slides). Citi Holdings posted a loss of $788M in Q1 vs. $1.1B a year ago (Citicorp net income was $4.8B in Q1). Legal costs alone at Citi Holdings were $644M in Q1 vs. just $66M for the rest of the bank. (earnings supplement)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:17 AM | 3 Comments
  • INVA

    Theravance (THRX +20.6%) tops the leader board as a staff report suggests Breo — a COPD...

    Theravance (THRX +20.6%) tops the leader board as a staff report suggests Breo — a COPD treatment the company is developing with GlaxoSmithKline (GSK +3.1%) — could be set for approval by the FDA which will evaluate a recommendation Wednesday. There were some questions about side effects which Citi and UBS analysts said were expected. THRX will get royalties of 15% on the first $3B in sales and 5% thereafter. 

     
     
     
     
    | 11:12 AM | 1 Comment
  • TMUS

    MetroPCS (PCS -3.6%) and Leap Wireless (LEAP -2.5%) slump in the wake of Dish Network's $25.5B...

    MetroPCS (PCS -3.6%) and Leap Wireless (LEAP -2.5%) slump in the wake of Dish Network's $25.5B offer for Sprint. The offer, which comes shortly after Bloomberg reported Dish had proposed a tie-up with T-Mobile USA (OTCQX:DTEGY), removes T-Mobile/MetroPCS as an M&A target (for now, at least), and lowers the odds of an offer for Leap. Should a Dish/Sprint merger happen, it would also potentially create a tougher rival for the low-end carriers, though Sprint/SoftBank would arguably do the same.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:03 AM
  • ALSN

    Allison Transmission (ALSN -4.2%) falls after announcing investment funds affiliated with the...

    Allison Transmission (ALSN -4.2%) falls after announcing investment funds affiliated with the Carlyle Group will sell 22M shares in a non-dilutive secondary offering. 

     
     
     
     
    | 10:58 AM
  • UNTK

    Shares of UniTek Global Services (UNTK -65%) get pummeled coming off a brief trading halt, after...

    Shares of UniTek Global Services (UNTK -65%) get pummeled coming off a brief trading halt, after disclosing late Friday that it has to restate financial results for the period beginning October, 2011 through September, 2012, due to an internal probe which revealed that several employees of it's Pinnacle Wireless unit had engaged in fraudulent activities that resulted in improper revenue recognition. The company also terminated its CFO and Treasurer, its controller and chief accounting officer, the president of Pinnacle's Wireless division, plus several other employees involved.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:41 AM
  • HMY

    It was difficult enough to maintain a profitable mine when the price of gold was relatively...

    It was difficult enough to maintain a profitable mine when the price of gold was relatively stable; with gold plummeting, there’s likely even more pain ahead. Citi’s Johann Steyn, who covers South African gold miners, downgrades his target price and earnings outlook for the entire sector, and cuts Harmony Gold (HMY -8.2%) to Sell. For what it's worth, he calls Gold Fields (GFI -3.2%) his favorite.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:37 AM | 3 Comments
  • BCRX

    BioCryst (BCRX +5%) moves up again today, adding to last week's gains as the number of bird flu...

    BioCryst (BCRX +5%) moves up again today, adding to last week's gains as the number of bird flu cases in China continues to increase. Recent reports now have the death toll at 14, with 61 confirmed cases. The stock has climbed nearly 21% in the past week, after China moved to expedite approval of it's anti-flu drug, Permavir, after six new cases of the H7N9 virus were diagnosed.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:28 AM
  • GLD

    "OK, so I made a bad call at the Barron's roundtable," tweets Bill Gross. "I would still buy...

    "OK, so I made a bad call at the Barron's roundtable," tweets Bill Gross. "I would still buy gold here. World reflating." After a morning bounce, gold has returned to the session low at $1,388/oz. GLD -6.7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:25 AM | 25 Comments
  • VZ

    Verizon Wireless (VZ, VOD) was the company that offered $1B-$1.5B for some of Clearwire's (CLWR...

    Verizon Wireless (VZ, VOD) was the company that offered $1B-$1.5B for some of Clearwire's (CLWR -2.8%) spectrum, the WSJ reports. Meanwhile, Dish (DISH -6.4%) says it hasn't formally withdrawn its $3.30/share offer for Clearwire, but would honor Sprint's (S +14.9%) $2.97/share offer. Naturally, Dish touts the potential of a Sprint merger to enable triple/quad-play bundles - a recent Consumer Reports survey drove highlighted their popularity. CEO Charlie Ergen also talks up the implications of soaring mobile data usage, and compares Dish's strategy to a Seinfeld episode where everything comes together in the last 2 minutes.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:22 AM | 2 Comments
  • MKTX

    MarketAxess (MKTX +3.9%) is markedly higher in early trading after Raymond James upgrades the...

    MarketAxess (MKTX +3.9%) is markedly higher in early trading after Raymond James upgrades the shares to Strong-Buy from Market Perform. Earlier this month, Financial Times suggested the firm could be positioned to take advantage of a shift in corporate bond trading to electronic platforms.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:22 AM

  • Underperforming today as commodities (DBC -1.7%) take a beating is Canada, the TSX -1.5%. Also...

    Underperforming today as commodities (DBC -1.7%) take a beating is Canada, the TSX -1.5%. Also seeing little love is the loonie (FXC -0.6%). The move in the MSCI Canada Index ETF (EWC -2.4%) reflects both the loss in shares and the currency. EWC is now off 5% YTD, trailing the S&P 500 by 1500 basis points.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:02 AM
  • SHW

    Sherwin-Williams (SHW +1.8%) trades higher to paint another all-time high after the company is...

    Sherwin-Williams (SHW +1.8%) trades higher to paint another all-time high after the company is raised to Overweight from Equal Weight by Morgan Stanley on its view more market share can be carved out. The new price target set by the investment firm is $194. More analyst love: Nomura lifts SHW to Buy.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:58 AM
  • NFLX

    BTIG's Richard Greenfield, bane of Facebook and Pandora bulls, has started coverage on Netflix...

    BTIG's Richard Greenfield, bane of Facebook and Pandora bulls, has started coverage on Netflix (NFLX +2.6%) with a Buy and $250 PT. Greenfield expects Netflix's value proposition and original content to "drive better than expected subscriber growth and moderate churn." He also declares Netflix's content expenses to be "sufficiently high," leading to operating leverage for future revenue growth. Wouldn't it have been better to make this thesis 3 months ago? (Goldman) (Evercore)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:55 AM | 3 Comments
  • SM

    SM Energy (SM -2.3%) announces positive exploration success in the Woodbine formation in...

    SM Energy (SM -2.3%) announces positive exploration success in the Woodbine formation in East Texas. The Horizon Properties 2H well produced ~740 boe/day in a 24-hour test; the well will be shut-in to await construction of a gathering system. Cowen expects the field to spark provide catalysts for shares during H2.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:46 AM
  • DISH

    Did Dish Network (NASDAQ:DISH) bite off too much to chew with its $25.5B bid for Sprint?...

    Did Dish Network (NASDAQ:DISH) bite off too much to chew with its $25.5B bid for Sprint? Investors looking for a quick return will have to wait years as any sort of makeover from the pay-TV business model to a new national LTE network will take years to roll out. Early market verdict:  DISH -2.0% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:28 AM
  • S

    Sprint (NYSE:S) +15.6%, Clearwire (CLWR) -2.8%, Dish Network (NASDAQ:DISH) -1.7%, and DirecTV...

    Sprint (NYSE:S) +15.6%, Clearwire (CLWR) -2.8%, Dish Network (NASDAQ:DISH) -1.7%, and DirecTV (NYSE:DTV) -1.1%, as the Street mulls the implications of Dish's $25.5B offer for Sprint (S). Dish, which has been looking for a partner for its 4G spectrum, claims a merger will result in $13B in cost/capex synergies, and yield a company with 20% EBITDA growth. Dish would fund the $17.3B cash portion of the deal using $8.2B in existing cash + debt, and foresees debt ratings of B1/B+. Sprint shareholders would own 32% of the company. No one ever accused Charlie Ergen of thinking small. (offer letter) (Dish fact sheet) (Clearwire spectrum offer) (Dish/Clearwire)

    A number of reasons have been given for gold's (NYSEARCA:GLD) sudden free-fall, chief among them the ECB's pressurization of Cyprus' central bank to sell its gold reserves to help pay for the country's bailout. Other factors include bearish forecasts such as from Goldman Sachs, the slow improvement in the U.S. economy, and the perception that gold is no longer needed as a safe haven.
